result.title: Objective
result.description: Objective: To establish a coordinated & decentralized system of sustainable agro-sylvo-pastoral land management in the Centre-West region.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
1. Number / percentage of relevant SLM interventions that are
(a) planned and
(b) implemented collaboratively among different stakeholder types
(c) and that are deemed relevant and effective by evaluation processes
Definitions:
[a] refers to identification, counting and planning of SLM interventions relevant to the project, both on the ground (i.e. at site level) and through enabling action; 'relevant' here means that interventions that are either
(i) spearheaded,
(ii) co-supported or
(iii) influenced by the project
[b] refers to the level of collaboration / coordination among stakeholders from implementation
[c] refers to the level of success of SLM interventions implemented, vis-a -vis the planned ones, with focus on relevance and effectiveness
[Means of Verification: through the project's SLM interventions database, planning and periodic reporting documents, plus other indirect means that can be assessed by the MTR and TE and]
[NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2014] Refer to reporting in 2014 for an explanation on the changes.

baseline.comment:
[1a] Both enabling and site-level SLM interventions in the Centre West region are still to be more carefully identified; PRODOC provides but generic guidance
[1b] No partnership or coordination mechanisms for SLM is in place in the region for implementation
[1c] The CPP-BdM (i.e. the Country Partnership Programme Burkina Faso, Boucle du Mouhoun Region CPP-BdM Sub-programme) in November 2013 and an evaluation schedule was developed
[NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2014] Refer to reporting in 2014 for an explanation on the changes.

target.comment:
General target: Existence in the region of a sustainable and efficient coordination mechanism for sustainable agro-sylvo-pastoral land management interventions leading to the coordination and joint planning of at least of 75% of SLM interventions in the region at the end of the project
[1a] The project keeps a thorough database of its SLM interventions and can document their planning and implementation the database issues a count for the number and nature of SLM interventions (i) spearheaded, (ii) co-supported or (iii) influenced by the project, upon which a benchmark percentage can be calculated
[1b] The Regional Consultation SLM Framework for the Boucle du Mouhoun Region is in place and meets regularly (with good prospects to continue to do so after project end) to propose, plan, foster and review the implementation of SLM interventions
[1c] An evaluative analysis of SLM interventions registered in the database establishes that at least 75% of them meet at least one of the criteria for the indicator: that they are coordinated, jointly planned or collaboratively implemented

actual.comment:
Target for 1 is generally on the way to being achieved. For sub indicators: Target achieved for 1a (database development); target achieved on a rolling basis for 1b (the Regional Partnership Platform for SLM is established and meets); and progress made towards the target for 1c (project provides support for sustainable agro-sylvo-pastoral land management interventions leading to the coordination and joint planning of SLM interventions in the region).
- Stakeholders on the frontline in terms of SLM in the region representing 30% of Regional Partnership Platform for SLM (RPP-SLM) were involved in the multi-stakeholder planning and in the evaluation of the implementation of three multi-stakeholder investment plans developed since 2013.
- RPP-SLM members who co-supported SLM actions in the region (STD, NGO, Administration, Consultants, Service Providers, Suppliers) representing 35% of platform members were involved at 50% the implementation of MOUs for the conduct of activities, either through the conduct of studies or the promotion and dissemination of SLM best practices on the sites in nine communes of the subprogram intervention area.
- Estimated at 35% of RPP-SLM members, 10 territorial communities, 13 associations, 05 producers? organizations benefited from the application of SLM best practices techniques on their sites.
b) Holding of three (03) sessions of the partnership platform for SLM on the following themes:
- Alternative conflict management ;
- Sharing of experiences on river bank protection among stakeholders of the region;
- Climate change and Sustainable Land Management. These three sessions enabled the increase and strengthening of the synergy in SLM interventions in the region of Boucle du Mouhoun.
c) Steering committee members met in two sessions to discuss and ensure the coordination of SLM activities (number of actors members of RPP-SLM); The development of PAIMR and PAIC enabled the joint planning of SLM activities in the region (number of actors involved in the PAIMR and PAIC)
Through 27 MOUs, the actors members of SLM platform collaborated for the implementation of activities (Promotion of SLM best practices in 51 villages and the conduct of studies and development of communication tools).

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: n/a

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Outcome 1) Land-use planning and coordination and partnerships for SLM established in the Boucle de Mouhoun Region

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: 2. Elaboration and revision of a regional, multi-stakeholder SLM action plan

baseline.comment: No such planning tool or cross-stakeholder concert exists

target.comment: A regional, multi-stakeholder SLM action plan is elaborated and revised annually through a participatory approach

actual.comment:
Target achieved, but quality of document remains to be assessed ‚Äì same as last year.
Joint development of three (03) regional annual multi-stakeholder investment plans (that of 2015) benefited from the involvement of 30 actors for the framing and consideration of activities of 35 partners members of RPP-SLM On Sustainable Land Management. The evaluation 2014 plan in which 40 actors were involved revealed a blossoming of synergy in SLM interventions in the region.

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: Outcome 2) Decentralization of SLM/NRM functions is effective

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
3. Number of regional, territorial and community institutions that undertake an effective role in SLM and NRM capacity to do so assessed through the application of the capacity development scorecard for SLM to the mentioned
[NOTE ON LOGFRAME 2014]
We have introduced the capacity element and a way of assessing through the scorecard. This was absent in the PRODOC logframe.

baseline.comment:
3a) No decentralization of SLM and NRM roles
[see below for 3b]

target.comment:
3a) At least 1 regional, 5 territorial and 35 community institutions undertake an effective role in SLM and NRM (planning, rules, budget management)
[see below for 3b]

actual.comment: Further progress made towards the target. One (01) regional institution mainly the regional partnership platform for sustainable land management set up in 2013 held three (03) new sessions (July 2014-June 2015) which gathered 180 SLM actors and professionals on themes such as: - Alternative conflict management ; - Sharing of experiences on river bank protection among stakeholders of the region; - Climate change and Sustainable Land Management. These sessions enabled the orientation and coordination of SLM action planning in Boucle du Mouhoun region; Nine (09) territorial institutions mainly communal platforms or consultation frameworks as well as provincial platforms (CCP) facilitated eight (08) fora for sharing and consultation on texts governing natural resource management (law related to land tenure security in rural areas, law on pastoralism, forest code, environmental code) for actors to fully play their role on SLM. Nineteen (19) community institutions on SLM sites, in the nine communes of subprogram intervention area agree on developed space exploitation and management rules based on adopted techniques of SLM best practices. Out of 1000 producers targeted, 825 Producers among whom more than 400 women?s capacities were built in order to improve the productivity of their activities; The capacities of more than 900 actors representing territorial collectivities, technical services, general administrative structures working in the area of SLM of the region were built to fully play their role on NRM/SLM. Annually partnership actors develop regional multi-stakeholder investment plan on SLM (PAIMR-SLM) in order to ensure the sustainable and peaceful management of natural resources of Boucle du Mouhoun region. The participation of the subprogram in the capitalization of National Rural Sector Program achievements (Agriculture, livestock, Environment) in the regional Directorates with same monitoring-evaluation tools opens prospects to harmonize monitoring-evaluation system on SLM in the region.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: [as above]

baseline.comment:
3b) Poor regional and local assumption of these functions
Baseline scores for the Capacity Development Scorecard for SLM:
tbd

target.comment: 3b) Application of the Capacity Development Scorecard for SLM shows an overall increase of 20% from baseline scores in absolute numbers.

actual.comment: Further progress made towards the target. Holding of three (03) sessions of the partnership platform for SLM on the following themes: - Alternative conflict management ; - Sharing of experiences on river bank protection among stakeholders of the region; - Climate change and Sustainable Land Management. These three sessions enabled the increase and strengthening of the synergy in SLM interventions in the region of Boucle du Mouhoun.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: [5a] Surface of farm land, pastoral areas, river banks and wetlands under SLM systems

baseline.comment: [5a] surface is yet to be defined for retained project sites

target.comment:
[5a] Surface area under SLM in the BM Region:
In the PRODOC, this is what had been proposed:
TOTAL: 200,000 hectares of land, as follows:
- 30,000 ha of irrigated and farm land
- 100,000 ha of pastoral areas
- 50,000 ha of river banks
- 20,000 ha of wetlands.

actual.comment:
Target basically achieved with 2733.90 ha, but experience with SLM practices over a few seasons is considered necessary for consolidation. The contribution of the subprogram to the achievement of this target at this stage is 2733.90 ha which is an increase of 1075.40 ha over the period from July 2014 to June 2015.
Furthermore, while waiting for the mid-term evaluation of the subprogram in 2015, which will enable the revision of certain targets in terms of surface area where SLM practices are being tested during the present phase, we highlight major progress made.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: [5b] Percentage of producers successfully applying innovative technologies tested and adapted to SLM in the region now broken down by type of technology

baseline.comment: [5b] Few, if any (to be determined at project start)

target.comment: [5b] 50 % of targeted farmers are applying SLM in their fields

actual.comment: Not possible to adequately report on this indicator as a percentage, because the target universe has not been set and some calculations are missing. We know that, to date, 825 producers of communes from subprogram area of intervention apply SLM best practices in their farms with the interventions of CPP-BMH. We do not know exactly how much a percentage of these households represent vis-a-vis the total target population.

result.title: Objective
result.description: Objective: To establish a coordinated & decentralized system of sustainable agro-sylvo-pastoral land management in the Centre-West region.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: 1. Number / percentage of relevant SLM interventions that are (a) planned and (b) implemented collaboratively among different stakeholder types (c) and that are deemed relevant and effective by evaluation processes Definitions: [a] refers to identification, counting and planning of SLM interventions relevant to the project, both on the ground (i.e. at site level) and through enabling action; ‚Äúrelevant‚Äù here means that interventions that are either (i) spearheaded, (ii) co-supported or (iii) influenced by the project [b] refers to the level of collaboration / coordination among stakeholders from implementation [c] refers to the level of success of SLM interventions implemented, vis-a-vis the planned ones, with focus on relevance and effectiveness [Means of Verification: through the project√É¬¢s SLM interventions database, planning and periodic reporting documents, plus other indirect means that can be assessed by the MTR and TE and] [NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2014] Refer to reporting in 2014 for an explanation on the changes.

baseline.comment:
[1a] Both enabling and site-level SLM interventions in the Centre West region are still to be more carefully identified; PRODOC provides but generic guidance
[1b] No partnership or coordination mechanisms for SLM is in place in the region for implementation
[1c] The CPP-CW (i.e. the Country Partnership Programme Burkina Faso, Centre-West Region CPP-CW Sub-programme) in November 2013 and an evaluation schedule was developed
[NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2014] Refer to reporting in 2014 for an explanation on the changes.

target.comment:
General target: Existence in the region of a sustainable and efficient coordination mechanism for sustainable agro-sylvo-pastoral land management interventions leading to the coordination and joint planning of at least of 75% of SLM interventions in the region at the end of the project
[1a] The project keeps a thorough database of its SLM interventions and can document their planning and implementation the database issues a count for the number and nature of SLM interventions (i) spearheaded, (ii) co-supported or (iii) influenced by the project, upon which a benchmark percentage can be calculated
[1b] The Regional Consultation SLM Framework for the Centre West Region is in place and meets regularly (with good prospects to continue to do so after project end) to propose, plan, foster and review the implementation of SLM interventions
[1c] An evaluative analysis of SLM interventions registered in the database establishes that at least 75% of them meet at least one of the criteria for the indicator: that they are coordinated, jointly planned or collaboratively implemented

actual.comment:
Target for indicators #1 is generally on the way to being achieved. For sub indicators it is as follows: Target achieved for 1a (database development); target achieved and being consolidated for 1b (the Regional Consultation SLM Framework for the Centre West Region); and this creates the basis for making progress towards the target for 1c (evaluative analysis of SLM interventions as a key tool for ensuring that SLM interventions being monitored are coordinated, jointly planned or collaboratively implemented
The mechanism, the Regional Consultation SLM Framework for the Centre West Region, is in place. Efforts were focused on all measures, actions and arrangements required for making more and more effective and sustainable. In fact, during the consultation process undertaken in the previous review period, the Center-West Regional Partnership Platform for sustainable land management was established by-law #2014-097/MATD/RCOS/GVT-KDG/SG of 11th September 2014 issued by the regional Authority. It is chaired by the Regional Council of Center-West which is a local government at the scale of the region to which the central Government has recently transferred the competency to manage the regional natural resources. The mandate is described in appropriate documents, but includes coordination, oversight and M&E of SLM interventions.
It was officially installed in its functions and has held two ordinary sessions during the period under review to validate the findings of studies on (i) the reference status of certain indicators of the logical framework of the CPP Center-West Sub-Program, (ii) the environmental profile of the Center-West Region and (iii) current status of the issues relating to the use and management of micro watersheds. It is gradually and actually gaining momentum with the development and validation of its roadmap for year2015. The Monitoring & Evaluation system owned by the Center-West CPP sub-program is being operationalized in the region. It is part of the National Environment and Sustainable Development Observatory (ONEDD) which is a global environmental monitoring instrument in Burkina Faso. It was put in place by the Permanent Secretariat of the National Council for Environment and Sustainable Development with the technical and financial support of the CPP National Coordination Sub-Program. It has a mechanism for collecting and processing available environmental information in the country to enhance the value and disseminate such information in the form of indicators, data and metadata. Its monitoring & evaluation system derived from the √Ç¬´ Pressure-State-Impact-Response√Ç¬ª model includes a specific component dedicated to SLM and named √Ç¬´ harmonized SLM Monitoring & Evaluation system? aimed at ensuring: Monitoring & Evaluation of the activities related to the implementation of the three Rio Conventions on namely the Convention to Combat Desertification and the ones on Climate Change and Biological Diversity ; The monitoring of SLM performance and outcome indicators; The management of a data base and metadata ; Harmonization of methods, standards and reference tools for data collection and processing. This mechanism is lead at the regional level by a focal point that provides support to the partners and stakeholders that are, through the partnerships agreements and charters that were signed, " data centers " for the various SLM components, producing information for their own needs with their core resources and feeding into the observatory in a " win-win " relationship

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: 2. Level of adoption or integration of SLM priorities and principles by key regional-level institutions, policies, strategies and planning frameworks

baseline.comment: Relevant regional program frameworks (i.e. regional-level institutions, policies, strategies and planning frameworks) have not integrated SLM priorities and principles; more specifically, PRODOC Table 5 establishes what the regional programming frameworks, but it is outdated

target.comment: The relevant regional programmatic frameworks to be targeted by the project have received assistance by the project and include SLM priorities and principles in their new planning cycle the level of adoption / integration of SLM priorities and principles will be independently assessed by the MTR and TE

actual.comment: Continued progress towards the target is made through extensive regional consultations and data compilation. The main regional framework of relevant programming targeted by this indicator is the Regional Development Plan (RDP) Central West whose client is the Regional Council. The strategy is to provide the region with a SLM action plan incorporating regional principles and priorities for SLM and thus provide the actors of the material to develop a new generation of Central West Regional Development Plan. The roadmap of the platform which consists of activities whose conduct is considered a prerequisite to creating the conditions for effective coordination of interventions and initiatives on SLM in the Central West region aims to make contribution all stakeholders and to coordinate their actions to achieve the Partnership's goals in SLM. The results of the implementation of the roadmap envisaged by year's end will learn about the ability of mobilization and coordination of interventions in support of SLM in the region. The analysis and lessons learned from this review will allow the platform to develop a three-year action plan whose implementation will enable the coordination, planning and joint implementation of interventions and initiatives including integrating the priorities and major principles of SLM in the Central West Region. We must remember that these principles and priorities have already been integrated into training modules provided to members of the SLM platform in Central West.

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Outcome 1) A Coordination platform for sustainable partnerships to enable an integrated approach to sustainable and equitable land management is established in the Centre-West Region

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
3. Existence of a regional SLM action plan validated by the platform and coordinating 75 % of the SLM interventions of relevant the projects and initiatives implemented in the region
[NOTE ON LOGFRAME 2014]
In order to standardise the language in indicators and facilitate the use of the SLM Interventions Database for informing this indicator, we changed:
"the SLM related activities of all the projects and initiatives implemented in the region"
to
"SLM interventions of relevant the projects and initiatives implemented in the region"

baseline.comment: No regional SLM platform that can be used as a coordinating framework between institutions and regional consultation frameworks dealing with sustainable land management

target.comment: The regional partnership platform for SLM including all the local authorities, project and others actors is functional and coordinate and link 75% of the activities related to SLM in the region through a multiyear regional action plan

actual.comment: Further progress made towards the target. The Center-West Regional Partnership Platform for Sustainable Land Management (CW/RPP-SLM) brings together about fifteen categories of SLM actors (Administrative Authorities, Decentralized Government Services, Research and /or Training Institutions, Local Governments, Traditional and Religious Leaders, SLM Projects / Programs, Youth Ecological Clubs (school and /or university), Decentralized financing structures of the rural sector, communicators/media, Associations, NGOs and umbrella structures active in the field of SLM, Representative of Agro-Sylvo-Pastoral and Fisheries professions and inter-professions, legal bodies for the settlement of rural land tenure-related conflicts, agricultural private sector (service providers, tools and inputs suppliers), agro-industrial companies, Mining companies). It was officially installed on 23 October 2014 and had its first ordinary session on the same day. This session was dedicated to the validation of the results of the baseline studies to develop the environmental profile and current status of micro-watershed management in the intervention zone of the Sub-Program. In view of operationalizing the platform, the Sub-program has supported the organization and holding of its second ordinary session in April 2015 which gave the opportunity to present and validate a roadmap for the implementation and coordination of SLM initiatives and actions in the region. The preliminary draft of the roadmap submitted for validation in the General Assembly meeting of the platform was proposed by its Permanent Technical Core Group (PTG) which includes decentralized rural development structures and projects and programs involved in SLM in the region. By initiating the roadmap for SLM activities in the region and development of a resource mobilization strategy to support its implementation, the platform is entering in its operational phase of coordination of SLM interventions. Part of the major activities in the roadmap is the organization of the regional SLM Day. Through this, the platform intends to raise the awareness of the general public and natural resource users in the region, on the issues and challenges related to (i) land degradation,(ii) absence of action towards sustainable natural resource management, (iii) economic, ecological and social sustainability of development actions. It is intended to secure their commitment to the implementation of actions that could contribute to reversing the current trend towards accelerated degradation of rural resources. To give ample room to the platform for exercising its prerogatives and asserts its leadership in the coordination of SLM initiatives and actions in the region, the Sub-program has given it a set of computer and audio-visual materials including a lap top, multipurpose printer, consumables, video projector and five GPS devices for geo localizing of SLM works.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: 4. The number of SLM interventions that have adopted the common goal and targets of the harmonized M and E system and agreed to use it for monitoring their achievements

baseline.comment: There is no synergy among the actions and investment related to SLM in the region

target.comment: 75% of SLM initiatives in the region shared the common goal and targets of the harmonized M and E system and contribute to its achievement

actual.comment: Further progress made towards the target. The model data base was developed during the previous period. It is being tested and gradually fed with data and information from baseline studies in the intervention area of the sub-program. It is also fed with data from the studies on the development of technical standards instrument and costs applicable to SLM in the region (which aims at identifying, updating and listing the number and nature of SLM best practices disseminate in the Center-West region) and this constitute a significant contribution to the achievement of this target. In addition, reaching this target goes through the effective operationalization of the regional monitoring and evaluation mechanism. To achieve this, actions will be undertaken to conduct in July, individual capacity building of the actors involved in the mechanism, in terms of SLM data collection, validation, registration, sending, processing and filing. At the end of these sessions, the trainees shall be able to carry out missions and produce the information required for filling in 44 SLM outcome indicators that will be pre-defined in the data base. The target audience is made up of representatives of SLM stakeholders most of whom are members of the regional SLM partnership platform. The feedback between ONEDD and intermediary structures for dissemination down to the grassroots level makes it possible to complete the circuit, thus facilitating the adoption ainsi use of this M & E system for the implementation of SLM initiatives and interventions in the region. To support the process and illustrate the feasibility of SLM, a participatory M & E manual drawing from a harmonized system and building on data from the baseline study for the Center-West CPP Sub-program intervention in its priority zone was developed during the period under review. The capacity building sessions planned during the month of July 2015 and beyond will incorporate the contents of this manual.

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: Outcome 2) An institutional and policy environment which enhances awareness and implementation of sustainable and equitable land management is strengthened in the Centre-West Region

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
5. Regional Natural Resources Management / Sustainable Land Management (NRM/SLM) platform established and sustained
[NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2014] Refer to reporting in 2014 for an explanation on the changes.

baseline.comment: A regional NRM/SLM platform for dealing with SLM issues in the Centre West Region does not exist or remains a proposal

target.comment: The Regional NRM/SLM platform for the Centre West Region has a multiyear functioning budget that allows it to convene annually and gather all relevant stakeholders by project end, with good prospects to remain so as assessed by the MTR and TE

actual.comment: Progress made towards the target. This budget is not yet in place and the functioning of the body is for the time being ensured with contributions from the public administration, local government, projects, programs and other actors. The current development of a resource mobilization strategy and its implementation will help to sustain the operations of the platform. The organization of a regional SLM Day such as mentioned above will create a forum for advocacy for establishing sustainable partnerships and mobilizing resources for SLM and its platform. Already, the Forest Investment Platform (FIP) which is part of the REDD+ Burkina Faso process financed by the World Bank and ADB is committed to co-financing the organization of this regional SLM Day.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: 6. Proportion of (a) legal / institutional, and (c) capacity constraints to SLM in the region identified in the frame of the national coordination subprogram that are solved through legal and regulatory reform

baseline.comment:
No mechanism to identify legal / institutional (a), and capacity (b) constraints to SLM and address them is in place
[6a] Major legal / institutional constrains (n=3):
- The implementation and enforcement of the New Land Tenure Law (Loi 034-2009 Portant R√É¬©gime Foncier Rural) in the CW region is but incipient
- The Regional NRM/SLM platform for the Centre West Region is not yet legally formalised
- The Regional NRM/SLM platform for the Centre West Region remains a proposal
[6b] Major capacity constraints (n=20)
Established through the application of a capacity development scorecard for SLM with 20 different combinations of scores, covering on the X-axe 3 levels of capacity (Systemic, Institutional and Individual) + 1 overall average, and on the Y-axe 5 capacity themes.
Baseline scores TBD

target.comment:
At least 50% of constraints identified (n=23) in the frame of the national coordination subprogram are solved through legal, institutional and regulatory reform
[6a] There is tangible progress in implementing the New Land Tenure Law in the CW Region, as assessed by the MTR and TE, and a regional decree has been approved establishing the TOR for the Regional NRM/SLM platform is legally established and meets regularly
[6b] Improvements in the total capacity score for SLM at 20% from the baseline√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s absolute number

actual.comment: Not possible to assess indicator achievement. No evaluation has yet been conducted on this indicator. However, the Sub-Program has undertaken to disseminate (i)five legislative and regulatory texts and (ii)five SLM planning and management tools in the field through information, sensitization and training sessions of actors from the regional level to the communal level with the support of relevant structures of the central level and support to the local media (print press and community radio stations). This will indeed contribute to removing identified barriers and constraints. It should be noted that five communes have received methodological, technical and financial support from the sub-program for the establishment of local structures for rural land tenure management and individual capacity building of their members. Additionnally, all members of the NRM/SLM platform have received capacity building sessions on (i) their roles and responsibilities within the platform, (ii) the functioning principles of the platform, (iii)NRM/SLM stakes and concepts, (iv) relevant texts and their overlappings in the area of NRM/SLM and (v) the alternative and judiciary regulations governing rural land tenure conflicts.

result.title: Outcome 3
result.description: Outcome 3) Promote practices of integrated, sustainable and equitable management of land which includes innovative practices or is based on local knowledge

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
7. SLM Practices on the ground:
[NOTE ON LOGFRAME 2014]
We are in the process of refining this indicator. There are no changes to its formulation or figures, only the break down in two sub-indicators for SLM Practices on the ground and the addition of "broken down by type of technology" in 7b.

baseline.comment: [see break-down below]

target.comment: [see break-down below]

actual.comment:
[see break-down below]
As of now, (beginning of second year of execution) only teaching and demonstration actions are being carried out in the field. Therefore, this indicator cannot be filled in. However, support for the promotion of SLM best practices including innovative practices or local knowledge-based practices is being continuously provided in the field since 2014.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: [7a] Surfaces of farm land, pastoral areas, river banks and wetlands under SLM systems

baseline.comment: [7a] surface is yet to be defined for retained project sites

target.comment:
[7a] Surface area under SLM in the CW Region:
In the PRODOC, this is what had been proposed:
50,000 ha of forest land
35,000 ha of pastoral zone
10,000 ha of river banks
5,000 ha wetlands
10,000 ha of agro biodiversity areas
10,000 ha of peripheral areas for fauna protection under permanent SLM system
The project will update the target with more accurate figures in the 2015 PIR.

actual.comment:
Not yet possible to update the target with more accurate figures.
On the scale of 41 micro-watersheds identified in the five pilot and that will be a common integrated management planning development of their natural resources, there is little or no land for different uses described in the PRODOC who are under Sustainable management. In the Priority Intervention Zone, the expected situation at the end of the project is as follows: 2000 ha of agricultural land 750 ha of forest land 1,500 hectares of agro- pastoral land and / or pasture areas 500 ha of banks 20 ha of wetlands 160 ha of irrigated land 375 hectares of eroded land The promotion of best practices was translated during the period under review, into: (i) development of detailed plans for the development of five model micro watersheds, at a rate of one per commune, selected from the 41 identified in 2014 in the communes of Bakata, Bougnounou, Dalo, Leo and To. In fact, a model micro watershed is a demonstration site of water and soil conservatory management techniques and technologies. It aims at serving as teaching farms for the dissemination of these techniques and technologies to all land users in the communes. These water and land development schemes cover the following topics: - Current state of land use and practices used in tapping on these resources; - Techniques and technologies to be used, - Detailed costs of infrastructure to be constructed in the sites ; - Building modalities of this infrastructure; - Timeframe given for the work; - Prerequisites before starting the work; - Training themes to be taught to the users of the micro-watersheds. In 2015, the targets in terms of areas under SLM are: 150 ha of agricultural land 50 hectares of agro- pastoral land (Tiare in the town of DALO) 20 ha of banks 30 ha of wetlands 30 ha of irrigated land 20 hectares of eroded land The operation will be assessed at the end of year 2015 and the lessons learned will serve for the gradual development of remaining micro watersheds and this, at the initiative of the various priority communes and with the support of their technical and financial partners including Center-West CPP.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: [7b] Percentage of producers successfully applying innovative technologies tested and adapted to SLM in the region now broken down by type of technology

baseline.comment: [7b] Few, if any (to be determined at project start)

target.comment: [7b] 50 % of targeted farmers are applying SLM in their fields

actual.comment:
Not yet possible to update the target with more accurate figures.
For the period under review, this indicators and its target were not measured. However, some actions towards the dissemination of SLM best practices and data collection to fill in the indicator were undertaken. In fact, to support the use of SLM techniques and technologies, the Sub-program has initiated capacity building actions (training sessions and establishment of teaching farms) for selected farmer trainer extensionists in each of the five pilot communes. Farmer trainer - extensionists are groups of producers selected from the local population to act as permanent technical relays for the dissemination of SLM best practices at the level of the commune in a context marked by central government and its local branches disinvestment in extension services so that they can refocus on their core functions. The five groups of farmer trainer extensionists constitute an initial core group that will be expanded through a networking system which is currently being developed. In order to strengthen the technical and teaching capacities of the farmer trainer extensionists for disseminating the relevant techniques and technologies, the trainings were supplemented with a study and exchange trip in the Northern region (deeply degraded) and Hauts-Bassins (agro-ecological conditions similar to those of the intervention zone of the Sub-program) where the communities, in order to preserve their natural resources, apply water and land conservation techniques and technologies in their farms. The purpose of the trip was to create enabling conditions for individual and collective awareness of natural resource degradation and sustainable management and to generate deeper conviction in the fulfilment of their new role.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description:
8. Forest loss and forest gain in demo sites, assessed visually through:
http://www.globalforestwatch.org/map
For the following variables:
UMD/Google tree cover loss (annual, 30m, global) - pink
UMD/Google tree cover gain (12 years, 30m, global) blue
More specifically:
http://www.globalforestwatch.org/map/10/11.35/-1.81/ALL/grayscale/loss,forestgain?begin=2001-01-01&end=2012-12-01&threshold=10
[NOTE ON LOGFRAME - 2014]
This is a new indicator.

baseline.comment:
(2013)
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/w6uavg2qdrpdntt/AADEG4OfewrJz2pK9idxRMjWa?dl=0
Specific monitored polygons, including control sites, remain to be defined and more accurate images acquired.
The service is free.

target.comment:
By project end, forest loss is minimal in the perimeters defined as project sites and where forest, as per the definitions of the tool, can be found.
Where possible, any new pink pixels within the defined monitored polygons will be counted annually and compared to the 2013 baseline.
(Each pixel represents a 30x30m area of forest, pink indicating loss).
This method, which is costless, should be able to illustrate what is happening to forests, where the project is expected to have a direct impact in halting the loss of forest and biomass.
(Some forest gain in project sites will also be noted, though this is not part of the target.)

actual.comment: Not possible to inform indicator. No measurement was made during the period under review. However, the baseline situation is being refined in order to facilitate future evaluations.

target.comment: At the end of the subprogram, at least 8 good-quality documents and 12 IEC products are elaborated by various organizations jointly

result.title: Objective
result.description: To generate global environmental benefits through improved decision-support mechanisms and improved local planning and development processes in Burkina Faso.

indicator.title: Indicator 1

actual.comment:
2 workshops were organized as follows :
The first workshop focused on improvement of information system for better environment management and contributed also to facilitate the data accessibility and dissemination. The workshop mobilized 32 participants including 4 women from partner organizations. The draft protocols (data sharing, dissemination) were adopted at the same meeting.
The second workshop was organized to finalize and adopt environmental data sharing mechanism, process of quality control, and validation process of environment product (natural resource, socio economic, development of policy, geo-information, and technologies, etc)
The workshop welcomed participation of 34 representatives from different institutions including 4 women.

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: A functioning, sustainable system for collecting, analyzing, storing and making available accurate, and reliable data and information related to all three Rio Conventions, and of direct use by decision-makers.

indicator.title: Indicator 1

actual.comment:
Short summary in terms of Target :
-On 9 month, the various thematic working groups are set up and initiated.
-On 12 month, project team initiated the mission in Italy to initiate the collaboration with research institution (North-South collaboration with National Research Center in Trieste) regarding data compatibility
-Planned for 2016 regarding an assessment of regional EMIS best practices etc
-On 9 month, the needs assessment of end-user have been conducted
-Planned in Quarter 3 and 4 of 2015 to establish working group on compatibility of ONEDD etc
-On month 12, interface of SIEL was revised in order to incorporate the aspect of MEA by project team in collaboration with co-finance COGEL project (UNDP‚Äôs Local Environment Governance Consolidation Project)
-On month 9 , basic agreement on the protocols for data collection, sharing, quality control, and verification has been done
-On month 12, a number of consultations were organized during the past 12 months. As a result, , action plan and ToRs for national team were elaborated/validated by national actors.
The capacity of staff within the key division to monitor/disseminate environmental data has been enhanced through establishment of North-South collaboration. The asset of this collaboration is inevitable in the improvement of environmental data management. In particular, it will allow increase the capacity for harmonization of data compatibility, and the data storage capability which will be very beneficial for end-users. Also, it will contribute significantly to the advancement of data and information management system. Further to this collaboration,, reconfiguration of high performance computer is currently on-going within the division of Ministry of Environment to optimize/diversify the data management tool. 13 offices of Regional Direction of Environment (1 in each of 13 administrative regions, in total 13 RDE in BKF) have received 1 desktop computer and 1 GPS for data collection. In total 13 desktops and 13 GPS have been acquisitioned by project and made at disposal of RDEs. This equipment will serve for data collection ( such as natural resource, socio-economical information, geo-information) and transmission of data to National Environment Observatory (ONEDD). In fact, partners at regional level had difficulty assuring data collection/ transmission due to unavailability of IT equipment. The concept note for Report of National Environmental Status of Burkina Faso (REEB) has been elaborated and presented to PNGIM (environment data collection/dissemination network composed of more than 32 key structures). REEB is one of the most important referential document and tool to monitor environmental status. Elaboration of REEB is obligation for country as a member of international community who adopted multi environmental convention. REEB therefore has become one of the document indispensable to refer to in the decision making in terms of natural resource conservation at all levels. The recruitment process of national consultant team for elaboration of REEB is on-going. 1500 copies of Journal of ¬´ Our Environment ¬ª have been published. This journal paper assures the visibility of activities of Ministry of Environment in particular, of the National Council for Environment and Sustainable Development (SP/CONEDD). This paper is one of the key tools for extensive officers in the field. It also increase advocacy and efforts to lobbying / sensitization of natural resource use at all level.

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: institutional capacity to plan and implement development processes that contribute to the implementation of the Rio Conventions and generate global environmental benefits.

indicator.title: Indicator 1

actual.comment: This activity is planned for second year (2016) of project implementation.
